results.title: Statins suppress cell-to-cell propagation of alpha-synuclein by lowering cholesterol
results.text_hl: Consistent with these observations, feeding a high-fat diet aggravated @GENE_SNCA @GENE_20617 @@@alpha-synuclein@@@ pathology and @<m>DISEASE_Attention_Deficit_and_Disruptive_Behavior_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019958 @@@behavioral deficits@@@ in the preformed fibril-injected @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model, an effect that was also reversed by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ administration.

citations.NLM: Min JO, Ho HA, Lee W, Jung BC, Park SJ, Kim S, Lee SJ. Statins suppress cell-to-cell propagation of alpha-synuclein by lowering cholesterol Cell Death Dis. 2023 Jul 27;14(7):474. PMID: 37500624
citations.BibTeX: @article{37500624, title={Statins suppress cell-to-cell propagation of alpha-synuclein by lowering cholesterol}, author={Min JO and Ho HA and Lee W and Jung BC and Park SJ and Kim S and Lee SJ}, journal={Cell Death Dis}, volume={14}, number={7}, pages={474}}

results.title: Simvastatin Prevents Neurodegeneration in the MPTP Mouse Model of Parkinson's Disease via Inhibition of A1 Reactive Astrocytes.
results.text_hl: We show that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ protects against the loss of @CHEMICAL_Dopamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004298 @@@dopamine@@@ neurons and @<m>DISEASE_Attention_Deficit_and_Disruptive_Behavior_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019958 @@@behavioral deficits@@@ in the @CHEMICAL_1_Methyl_4_phenyl_1_2_3_6_tetrahydropyridine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015632 @@@MPTP@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model of @DISEASE_Parkinson_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D010300 @@@PD@@@.

citations.NLM: Du RW, Bu WG. Simvastatin Prevents Neurodegeneration in the MPTP Mouse Model of Parkinson's Disease via Inhibition of A1 Reactive Astrocytes. Neuroimmunomodulation. 2021;28(2):82-89. PMID: 33735898
citations.BibTeX: @article{33735898, title={Simvastatin Prevents Neurodegeneration in the MPTP Mouse Model of Parkinson's Disease via Inhibition of A1 Reactive Astrocytes.}, author={Du RW and Bu WG}, journal={Neuroimmunomodulation}, volume={28}, number={2}, pages={82-89}}

results.title: Simvastatin Restores HDAC1/2 Activity and Improves Behavioral Deficits in Angelman Syndrome Model Mouse
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ Restores HDAC1/2 Activity and Improves @<m>DISEASE_Attention_Deficit_and_Disruptive_Behavior_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019958 @@@Behavioral Deficits@@@ in @DISEASE_Angelman_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D017204 @@@Angelman Syndrome@@@ Model Mouse

results.title: Simvastatin enhances learning and memory independent of amyloid load in mice.
results.text_hl: Our objective was to determine whether administering a statin drug (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@) would protect against the development of @<m>DISEASE_Attention_Deficit_and_Disruptive_Behavior_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D019958 @@@behavioral deficits@@@ in an established @SPECIES_10090 @@@mouse@@@ model of @DISEASE_Alzheimer_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000544 @@@Alzheimer's disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Li L, Cao D, Kim H, Lester R, Fukuchi K. Simvastatin enhances learning and memory independent of amyloid load in mice. Ann Neurol. 2006 Dec;60(6):729-39. PMID: 17192930
citations.BibTeX: @article{17192930, title={Simvastatin enhances learning and memory independent of amyloid load in mice.}, author={Li L and Cao D and Kim H and Lester R and Fukuchi K}, journal={Ann Neurol}, volume={60}, number={6}, pages={729-39}}
